data.event: Newport was settled c. 1791 by James Taylor Jr. on land purchased by his father James Sr. from George Muse, who received it as a grant.

event.title: was established as a town on December 14, 1795

data.event: Newport was established as a town on December 14, 1795, and incorporated as a city on February 24, 1834.

event.title: incorporated as a city on February 24, 1834

data.event: Newport was established as a town on December 14, 1795, and incorporated as a city on February 24, 1834.
A bridge first connected Newport to Covington in 1853, and the first bridge spanning the Ohio River to Cincinnati, the John A. Roebling Suspension Bridge, opened in 1866.
